Testing out the new characters in-game. The few extra pixels added to the characters' head means assets need to be bigger now - the trees, for example, now look like baby trees, gah.

items.content_html:
Swanky Paint Alpha +11 features, 'A Pond', by Frances MacDonald in the Swanky32 palette. The tadpoles and dragonfly nymphs were a challenge to translate into large pixels. Even so, I like to think the Swan King is very much in his elements here :}

items.content_html:
We're both currently in full development mode to bring Swanky Paint to her latest version, Alpha +11. It's a huge update with many features, bug fixes and most notably, a rehaul of the user interface design (both visual and structural).

items.content_html:
New IT Stuff redesign using our new web framework, ^plated. The old server died and became unreliable (we've now moved server and upgraded for less!) so everything went with it. Our previous framework (pagecake) allowed you to edit stuff on the go but it also meant backups were manual which was not ideal. We've learnt a lot from a decade of using the system extensively so ^plated is the end result of all those years.
shi at Thu 12 Jul 16:55:04 BST 2018 on ripley
items.title: shi at Thu 12 Jul 16:55:04 BST 2018 on ripley

items.content_html:
Flexing old graphic design skills for a concert flyer I'm performing in. Took quite a while for the ol' noggin to get going but when it did, it wouldn't let me stop. Having literally forced myself to stop, there are now just 25 iterations to choose from (all of which I'm not really satisfied with - no surprises there!) - should prolly whittle it down to 5 or something :}

items.content_html:
Eyes are crossed squinting at the screen - a different pixel here, another pixel there makes an eyeball or an xtra head. I've currently kept animation frames to a minimum but that's enough to create an acceptable breathing sequence. All of the characters have the same treatment for now but that should change later.
